definition: to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
variant of 照[zhao4]/to shine/to illuminate
to be indebted to sb for care/thank you for looking after me
please treat me kindly (conventional greeting on first meeting)

sentences.english: Whenever you need money, send me words three weeks ahead.
sentences.chinese: 无论何时假如你需要钱，请于三星期前来信关照。

sentences.english: After Marquis also invited a lot of attention.
sentences.chinese: 以后还请侯爵多多关照。

sentences.english: The fire had crumbled down to greyness, and one of the lamps made a gurgling appeal for attention.
sentences.chinese: 炉火已经暗淡，一盏灯咯咯响着请求关照。

sentences.english: Book art is the natural and human attention, imagery, America has become the main pursuit.
sentences.chinese: 书艺是对自然以及人的关照，意象美成为了主要追求。

sentences.english: New report, Nice to meet you.
I know little about the stock and hope you give me more support and consideration.
sentences.chinese: 这回请你多多关照，我对股票知之甚少。

sentences.english: The cold, pale sunlight fell on their gloomy faces, long hair and lusterless eyes.
sentences.chinese: 冷淡的阳关照著他们的愁眉苦脸和长发白眼。

sentences.english: Newland will particularly appreciate what you have done because of dear May and his new relations.
sentences.chinese: 你对梅和他的新亲戚的关照，纽兰会分外感激的。

sentences.english: I am truly honored by the kindnessattention you have shown me today.
sentences.chinese: 今天你们对我的厚意与关照，我真的感到很荣幸。

sentences.english: I am inexperienced, but also invite more attention.
sentences.chinese: 我初出茅庐，还请多多关照。

sentences.english: We shall be glad if you will se to it that the contract is duly signed.
sentences.chinese: 如果你方对合同圆满签字给予关照，我们将十分高兴。

sentences.english: Special to employ seafarers post, hope that the leadership of more concern.
sentences.chinese: 特来聘海员一职，希望各位领导多多关照。

sentences.english: The hope in later day, we looks after mutually, helps mutually.
sentences.chinese: 英语翻译希望在以后的日子里，我们互相关照。

sentences.english: Studying history is not only to seek the anecdote in the recesses, but to pay close attention to the reality.
sentences.chinese: 历史研究并非只为索隐钩沉，主要在于关照现实。

sentences.english: Now, then, I must see you all back into your rooms;
sentences.chinese: 好吧，现在我得关照大家回自己房间里去。

sentences.english: The third is to surpass the realism, guide the future.
sentences.chinese: 三是实现河现实关照的趄越指向未来。

definition: to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to rely on/to depend on
to correlate with/to correspond to
to look after/to take care of/to attend to
asylum/shelter/to shield/to put under protection/to take under one's wing
to help/to assist financially
to point out/to indicate/to give directions/to show how (to do sth)/to censure/to pick at
to tend/to take care of sb
to be concerned about/to care about
to be indebted (to sb)
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to cherish/to treasure/to take care of/to love and protect
to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
to give instructions/to give advice
